France moves to phase out support system for Ukrainian refugees
subhead: With budget constraints tightening, aid and accommodation for displaced Ukrainians in France are gradually winding down. Many complex situations remain unresolved, leaving families without a path to independence.

title: Germany says it foiled a potential 'Islamist' plot to attack a Christmas market
subhead: Authorities said they had arrested five men on suspicion of a plot to plow a vehicle into a Christmas market. It was unclear where the attack was supposed to take place or which market was to be targeted.

title: Sant Ambroeus brings Italian flair to Paris's Latin Quarter
subhead: The New York café-restaurant frequented by celebrities has opened a new location in the elegant Saint-Germain-des-Prés district, offering an Italian-American menu in an atmosphere inspired by the 1930s.

title: Mory Sacko, the calm celebrity chef: 'I have no score to settle with life'
subhead: He rose to fame on 'Top Chef' in 2020 and has since become a charismatic figure in France's new wave of gastronomy. At the helm of Mosuke, his Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris, Mory Sacko has created a small culinary empire built on joy and serenity.

Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
subhead: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

title: Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.
